subject: ACCT
outcomes: Confidently communicate accounting concepts to stakeholders to influence business and investor decisions.
Construct clear and accurate financial statements and explain the inter-relationships of their components to support strong business decision-making.
Discuss the potential impacts of business decisions on internal and external stakeholders to develop and express professional judgment.
Evaluate the appropriateness of accounting policies used to prepare financial statements to accurately determine the financial position and performance of a range of companies.

Synthesise information relating to national and international developments in accounting standard setting, accounting research, and media reports to discuss how real-world companies are impacted by accounting.
Use accounting methods and industry software to accurately record business transactions.
